summary:
+ An accomplished reliability & maintenance engineering professional with vast experience in diverse industries including oil and gas (offshore/onshore exploration and production), power generation, semiconductor, chemical, pharmaceuticals manufacturing, agri/foods/feed processing and nutrition.

+ System-process-thinking, structured problem-solving skill, pragmatic, analytical and data-driven with strong interest and passion in the field of reliability & quality engineering, technological innovation (that shapes the future of mankind) and digitalization.

profile_positions.description:
Member of ADM Global Reliability Centered Maintenance, Center of Excellence (RCM CoE), based in Rotterdam, The Netherlands. Development, deployment and implementation of strategic & tactical asset reliability programs, frameworks and strategies for multiple ADM sites of diverse business portfolios within Western Europe (EMEA) regions including The Netherlands, France, Germany & Spain.

Lead and drive Zero Failure initiatives across regional sites with structured Root Cause & Threat Elimination Program, a two-pronged approach & strategic framework through:

(1) Identification of top asset bad actors (performance, costs, chronic failures) that adversely affect plant's business objectives with Pareto Analysis (prioritizing top production losses, corrective maintenance costs, unplanned downtime hours), and;

(2) Elimination process of failure modes and their specific causes with Root Cause Analysis (RCA) and FMEA risk identification and mitigation tools through CAPA (Corrective And Preventive Actions) management process. 

Expand the program with system reliability analysis utilizing RBD and FTA, identifying system's vulnerability to functional failure and measuring RAM parameters of system and its sub-systems (failure rate, MTBF, MTTR, R%, A%, M%). Assess and evaluate systems' failure characteristics with Weibull Analysis (shape parameter, B10, T63 life), calculate achieved Reliability%, Availability% and Maintainability% vs OEE%, and recommend CAPA to improve systems' RAM to meet OEE goals through the improvement of system design (durability, robustness, redundancy, DfR, DfM), operating conditions (standard procedures, operating envelopes control) and prescribed maintenance strategies (PM, PdM) through RCM Analyses. Measure and track reliability (MTBF) improvement with Reliability Growth Analysis (Crow-AMSAA). 

Train, coach and mentor REs within the region on CI Zero Failure efforts, reliability elements, analytics and metrics, RCA and PdM technical advisory/support.
profile_positions.title: Regional Reliability Engineer, EMEA

profile_positions.description:
An instrumental member of Technical Services, Reliability Department with ADNOC Gas Processing, based at major midstream gas compression and processing plant in Habshan and Bab, emirate of Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates (UAE). Specialize in assets and plant reliability improvement strategies including RCA, RCM, CBM, PdM, RAM Analysis, FMEA, Reliability Growth (MTBF) Analysis, Bad Actor Management (BAM), Defect Elimination (DE), Lean Six Sigma, coaching and mentoring. 

A trained and effective RCA facilitator with PROACT® RCA methodology, CAPA management with QUARTZ system. Utilized MAXIMO CMMS for detailed reliability analytics to identify bad actors (data historian and pareto analysis), Run Log for trips analysis, RCM & RAM studies, BI Report for critical assets' reliability, availability (MTBF, MTTR) & utilization rate metrics. Conducted system reliability and vulnerability studies with RBD, FTA, Weibull analysis, quantitatively evaluating failure modes' characteristics (Weibull & RAM parameters), identifying their risks and threats to systems' availability, implementing RCM-driven mitigation measures to reduce risk consequences (HSE & Operational). 

Leveraged on-line asset health and performance monitoring systems in aiding critical assets' visibility and failure modes detectability through systematic reporting, statistical process control (SPC) and dashboard visualization. Member of site's Digitalization Transformation Journey Team, enhancing critical assets' availability and reliability with emerging technologies including big data, predictive analytics, IIoT, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML); partnering with vendors and OEM. Trained in RCM (Reliability Centered Maintenance) studies and analyses based on SAE-JA1011 Standard & RCM2™ (by John Moubray - Aladon) method.

Acquired professional certifications including:
- Asset Reliability Practitioner Category-1 (ARP-1) by MOBIUS Institute
- Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt by Six Sigma Council (SSC)

profile_positions.description:
An integral member of regional CBRE Reliability Community of Practice (CoP) between APAC, UK and EU Operational Excellence (OE) networks, assigned to support major client, MSD (Merck Sharp & Dohme) Pharmaceuticals, based at MSD API (Active Pharmaceutical Ingredient) Manufacturing Plant in Tuas Singapore. Reporting to site Technical Director in Singapore, dotted line to Global Reliability OE Director in the UK. 

Led, developed and deployed reliability improvement strategy framework at the site driving MSD's global RBAM (Risk-Based Asset Management) reliability excellence strategic goals; including site reliability and maintenance KPIs, performance metrics dashboard, RCA & RCFA, Visual Performance Management (VPM), Bad Actor Management (BAM) Program, RAM Analysis, System Reliability Analysis (with RBD + FTA), Predictive Maintenance (PdM) with Condition Monitoring (CM), DMAIC methodology & maintenance effectiveness optimization.

As RCA facilitator for major unscheduled events/failures, Notice Of Events (NOE) on assets critical to process and quality (CTP, CTQ), identifying underlying root cause(s) with A3 RCA methodology. Integrated reliability tools including RBD, FTA, RAM parameters into RCA/RCFA case studies, identified system's existing risks to functional failure & availability to production. Proposed effective CAPA to address failure modes & causes, improving systems' reliability (MTBF) and maintainability (MTTR), ultimately enhancing systems availability.

profile_positions.description:
As Maintenance Section Lead for Mechanical and Process Department, managed team of maintenance technicians, overseeing plant assets' reliability and maintenance performance at Givaudan's new semi-automated raw materials compounding plant in Pioneer, Singapore. Led, developed and implemented asset reliability management programs in maintenance section with RCA/RCFA, CBM, PdM, RAM (Reliability, Availability & Maintainability) Analysis, Bad Actors/Defect Elimination, Data Visualization & KPI Dashboard, TPM (Total Productive Maintenance) powered by Lean Six Sigma and Continuous Improvement (CI). 

A lead investigator, facilitating formal RCA workshops on equipment failure and breakdown events with multi-disciplinary, cross-functional team. Coached, empowered and mentored technicians on reliability terminologies (MTBF, MTTR, Availability, Failure Modes, OEE), RCA fundamentals and basics, hands-on & practical on-the-job training (OJT) utilizing CBM (Condition-Based Maintenance) techniques on rotating machinery with vibration analysis, dynamic process parameters measurement (pressure, temperature, flow rate, etc), asset health and performance monitoring (V, A, Torque, kW, RPM, running hours, etc). 

Maximized the value of RCA with Kaizen (improvement) and Hansei (learning) concepts, through lessons learning library, cost-benefits analysis, PDCA principle, towards building reliability, structured problem-solving and continuous improvement culture within the site. Involved in production enhancement CAPEX projects, compounding-plant expansion "Project Ruby", collaborating with Quality and Production Department, and appointed EPC contractors, on successful new equipment testing, commissioning & qualification phases including SAT, IQ, OQ & PQ. Instrumental in the completion of rigorous Lean Six Sigma 5S Project of Spare Parts Room, together with Maintenance & CI Black Belt Team.

profile_positions.description:
Based in Dhahran, Al-Khobar, Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (KSA). Member of Drilling Optimization and Application Engineering Team, Baker Hughes Saudi played key role in pre-well planning, real-time drilling operations remote monitoring and post-well review and analysis, for Baker Hughes Integrated Operations (BHIO) Turn-Key Projects, for multilateral wells oilfield service provisions at Shaybah Field and other high-profile projects for major client, Saudi Aramco. 

Overseeing operations, real-time monitoring and data analysis, applications engineering (simulation and modelling, finite element analysis, torque & drag, MSE - Mechanical Specific Energy, drill-string dynamics, hydraulics modelling, bending moment, critical speed/resonance analysis, torsional & axial vibration analysis), performance (failure and reliability data for FRACAS) and optimization analysis reports for major client Saudi Aramco.

Focal point of 24/7 BEACON RTOC (Real Time Operations Center) at Baker Hughes Dhahran Operations Base, provide specialized monitoring and surveillance services of real-time drilling data through “live” rig data monitoring, trending, anomaly detection and intervention, for safe and optimized operations. 

Conducted case study on an ERD well for client from offset wells drilling data and generated MSE curves and determined key areas of drilling to improve ROP, and reduced MSE through vibration control, drilling parameters optimization and BHA/Bit design consideration to improve drilling efficiencies and performance in pre-well planning phase.

Awarded 1-Year Service Award by Baker Hughes CEO in year 2014.

Back to offshore as Senior Field Engineer, leading Halliburton Drilling & Evaluation (D&E) offshore field engineers team delivering superior performance of operational excellence in various offshore high profile projects for major clients including Petronas, Shell, Newfield, PTTEP and Nippon Oil.  Led offshore team in the commissioning, running of advanced, high-tech well drilling and formation evaluation equipment at offshore sites including surface equipment rigging-up, downhole equipment testing, commissioning, calibration, assembly, maintenance, along with specialized services of real-time data acquisition, high density image and data processing, data interpretation, analysis and data plotting (visualization & presentation) for clients deliverables.

Performed failure investigation & analysis reports for all field-based failures, both system and component levels of downhole and surface equipment (including software issues). Supported Field Service Quality (FSQC) Team identifying root causes with RCA and defining failure recurrence prevention measures including manufacturing and assembly defects reduction (QA/QC), condition-based maintenance (CBM), applications of PWD (Pressure-While-Drilling), DOC (Drilling-Optimization-Collar), DDS (Dynamic Drill String) sensors to detect severe conditions (vibrations, torque, drag, circulating density, temperature, bending moment) and activate proactive intervention in real-time via RTOC (Real-Time Operations Center) by optimizing operating parameters and envelopes.

Complied with the highest standard of safety governed by the company’s HSE policies and regulations while performing duties and tasks including PTW (Permit-To-Work) System, STOP CARD/Hazard Observation Card (HOC), JSA (Job Safety Analysis) and Tool-Box meeting. Coached and mentored junior field engineers with structured competency, OJT-based and elementary training framework.

Awarded 5-Year Service Award by Halliburton CEO in year 2011.
